comments:
Created Visual class (JFrame) after having found and installed new features (EMF, GEF, VE (1.1.0.1)) through Eclipse. Opening the class in a text editor works ok, but when opening the class from the package explorer, I get: 
  org.eclipse.jface.util.Assert$AssertionFailedException: null argument;

Eclipse environment: eclipse-SDK-3.2M4-win32, jdk1.5.0_06.
EMF: 2.1.1
GEF: 3.1.1
VE   1.1.0.1

In a previous bug report (https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=122131) I saw an entry mentioning -- Eclipse 3.1.1 can only support VE 1.1.0.1 and Eclipse 3.2 can only use the 1.2M1 build. They can't be interchanged.-- 

However, when I found and installed the Eclipse features, I didn't have any choice regarding version 1.2 for VE. My choice was 1.1.0.1.

Opening the class, I get the following message and error trace:
#####

(In reply to comment #0)
> Created Visual class (JFrame) after having found and installed new features
> (EMF, GEF, VE (1.1.0.1)) through Eclipse. Opening the class in a text editor
> works ok, but when opening the class from the package explorer, I get: 
>   org.eclipse.jface.util.Assert$AssertionFailedException: null argument;
> 
> Eclipse environment: eclipse-SDK-3.2M4-win32, jdk1.5.0_06.
> EMF: 2.1.1
> GEF: 3.1.1
> VE   1.1.0.1
> 
> In a previous bug report (https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=122131)
> I saw an entry mentioning -- Eclipse 3.1.1 can only support VE 1.1.0.1 and
> Eclipse 3.2 can only use the 1.2M1 build. They can't be interchanged.-- 
> 
> However, when I found and installed the Eclipse features, I didn't have any
> choice regarding version 1.2 for VE. My choice was 1.1.0.1.
> 

You are correct in that VE 1.2M1 will only work with Eclipse 3.2M4. If you are using Update Manager to install VE, this won't work because only releases show up(e.g. 1.1.0.1). You need to download and unzip the zips into your eclipse install directory. Then start eclipse with the -clean option to pickup the new plugins.
For VE 1.2M1, you will need Eclipse 3.2M4, EMF 2.2.0M4, and GEF 3.2M4. Links to these drivers can be found on the VE 1.2M1 driver page -->http://download.eclipse.org/tools/ve/downloads/drops/S-1.2M1-200512210749/index.html
